alert.note: Alert for Little Colorado River Valley in Navajo County (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 16 at 4:31PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Navajo County near Williams through 500 PM MST... At 431 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles southeast of Winslow, moving southwest at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of Navajo County. This includes the following highways... Business Interstate 40 between mile markers 256 and 257. Interstate 40 between mile markers 257 and 269. State Route 87 mile marker 340 and near mile marker 346. State Route 99 between mile markers 34 and 41. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Little Colorado River Valley in Navajo County
